shr Reference Model Version 1.0.0
obf

Entry PractitionerRole

Documentation:

PractitionerRole covers the recording of the location and types of services that Practitioners are able to provide for an organization.

Ancestors:
  • Resource
    • DomainResource
      • InformationItem
        • EntityOrRole
          • Role
            • PractitionerRole
Used By:
  • Attester, 
  • Author, 
  • GroupParticipant, 
  • ManagingEntity, 
  • QuestionnaireResponseRecorder, 
  • Requester

    • Field Summary

      Properties Defined Constraints Value
      RoleSpecificIdentifier

      Business Identifiers that are specific to a role/location
      DataType
      Cardinality
      RoleSpecificIdentifier
      0..*
      Active

      Whether the record is in use (true) or retired (false).
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Active
      0..1
      TimePeriod

      A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year. If the start date/time is missing, the start of the period is not known. If the end date/time is missing, it means that the period is ongoing.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      TimePeriod
      0..1
      Practitioner

      A person who practices a healing art. HumanName is limited to one required value by US-Core. Gender is required by US-Core. US-Core required an identifier, either a NPI (required if known) or tax id (permitted alternative).
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Practitioner
      0..1
      Organization

      A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action. Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, payer/insurer, etc.

      Organization type is restricted to 0..1 in FHIR DSTU2, similarly restricted here. Other required attributes come from STU 3 mapping to us-core-organization.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Organization
      0..1
      Code

      The main type identifier for a lab, procedure, condition, etc., usually drawn from a controlled vocabulary.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Value Set
      Code
      0..*
      http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/practitioner-role (PREFERRED)
      Specialty

      The specialty of a practitioner who (should, will, or did) perform a service.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Specialty
      0..*
      Location

      Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Location
      0..*
      HealthcareService

      The details of a healthcare service available at a location.
      DataType
      Cardinality

      An electronic means of contacting an organization or individual.
      DataType

      Times the Service Site is available
      DataType
      Cardinality
      AvailableTime
      0..*
      NotAvailable

      Not available during this time due to provided reason
      DataType
      Cardinality
      NotAvailable
      0..*
      AvailabilityExceptions

      A description of when the locations opening ours are different to normal, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as detailed in the opening hours Times.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      AvailabilityExceptions
      0..1
      RoleSpecificEndpoint

      Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the practitioner with this role
      DataType
